title: One Big Beautiful Bill - $1 Trillion Healthcare Cuts
summary: Trump signed H.R. 1 (One Big Beautiful Bill) cutting over $1 trillion from health programs - largest rollback of federal support for healthcare in American history. CBO estimates 10 million more uninsured. Cuts $1 trillion from Medicaid through work requirements and provider tax restrictions. Rural hospitals lose 20%+ funding.
keyFacts: Signed July 4, 2025 - cuts over $1 trillion from health programs
Congressional Budget Office: 10 million more people without health insurance by 2034
Some estimates show 12 million more uninsured when including ACA marketplace changes
$1.1 trillion cut from healthcare spending over next decade
More than $1 trillion of cuts come from Medicaid
New Medicaid work requirements expected to end coverage for millions who don't meet employment standards
Provider tax restrictions curtail how states increase Medicaid payments to hospitals and nursing homes
Rural hospitals lose over 20% of funding in more than half of states
Hospitals would lose 18% of Medicaid funding - nearly $665 billion over 10 years
Nine-year ban on implementing improvements to Medicare Savings Programs for lower-income beneficiaries
Medicines for rare diseases exempted from Medicare drug price negotiations (benefit pharmaceutical companies)
Law adds $3.4 trillion to deficit despite massive healthcare cuts
Described as 'devastating' for reproductive health care coverage
States scrambling to shield hospitals from cuts
